title: Quality Engineer
descriptionHtml:
At American Express, our culture is built on a 175-year history of innovation, shared values and Leadership Behaviors, and an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities, and colleagues. As part of Team Amex, you'll experience this powerful backing with comprehensive support for your holistic well-being and many opportunities to learn new skills, develop as a leader, and grow your career.

Here, your voice and ideas matter, your work makes an impact, and together, you will help us define the future of American Express.

The Team?
The GCST Cross Platform Delivery (CPD) works on Enterprise Top Initiatives, designing, managing and testing comprehensive end to end customer and servicing journeys across multiple platforms and applications for American Express at scale.
What are we looking for?
A Quality Engineer with:
  • Experience contributing and improving automation and tooling
  • Experience dealing with various Amex platforms and Systems of Record
  • Experience or ambition to work across projects, understand journeys and work with key stakeholders in the Product organization
What will you do?
  • You'll work with Product Owners, Solution Architects and Delivery Managers to understand the project scope and convert that into customer and servicing journeys and then transform that into automated scenarios
  • You'll be writing automation to test a variety of applications, inside and outside of GCST, front end and back end, to enable the automated testing of end-to-end user journeys and the creation of test data
  • You'll work on our React One App to enhance our capability to create and modify test data across Amex platforms
What will you need?
  • A proactive and collaborative mind-set
  • Hands on experience automating
  • Familiarity with JavaScript, to work with WdIO and ReactJS
  • Eagerness to learn new technologies and articulate technical concepts to non-technical colleagues
Salary Range: $85,000.00 to $150,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected hourly pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

We back you with benefits that support your holistic well-being so you can be and deliver your best. This means caring for you and your loved ones' physical, financial, and mental health, as well as providing the flexibility you need to thrive personally and professionally.

For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law. American Express will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with arrest or conviction records, in accordance with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including, but not limited to, the California Fair Chance Act, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. For positions covered by federal and/or state banking regulations, American Express will comply with such regulations as it relates to the consideration of applicants with criminal convictions.

We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

US Job Seekers - Click to view the “Know Your Rights” poster. If the link does not work, you may access the poster by copying and pasting the following URL in a new browser window: https://www.eeoc.gov/poster

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.
descriptionText: At American Express, our culture is built on a 175-year history of innovation, shared values and Leadership Behaviors, and an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities, and colleagues. As part of Team Amex, you'll experience this powerful backing with comprehensive support for your holistic well-being and many opportunities to learn new skills, develop as a leader, and grow your career.Here, your voice and ideas matter, your work makes an impact, and together, you will help us define the future of American Express.The Team?The GCST Cross Platform Delivery (CPD) works on Enterprise Top Initiatives, designing, managing and testing comprehensive end to end customer and servicing journeys across multiple platforms and applications for American Express at scale.What are we looking for?A Quality Engineer with:Experience contributing and improving automation and toolingExperience dealing with various Amex platforms and Systems of RecordExperience or ambition to work across projects, understand journeys and work with key stakeholders in the Product organizationWhat will you do?You'll work with Product Owners, Solution Architects and Delivery Managers to understand the project scope and convert that into customer and servicing journeys and then transform that into automated scenariosYou'll be writing automation to test a variety of applications, inside and outside of GCST, front end and back end, to enable the automated testing of end-to-end user journeys and the creation of test dataYou'll work on our React One App to enhance our capability to create and modify test data across Amex platformsWhat will you need?A proactive and collaborative mind-setHands on experience automatingFamiliarity with JavaScript, to work with WdIO and ReactJSEagerness to learn new technologies and articulate technical concepts to non-technical colleaguesSalary Range: $85,000.00 to $150,000.00 annually + bonus + benefitsThe above represents the expected hourly pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.We back you with benefits that support your holistic well-being so you can be and deliver your best. This means caring for you and your loved ones' physical, financial, and mental health, as well as providing the flexibility you need to thrive personally and professionally.For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law. American Express will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with arrest or conviction records, in accordance with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including, but not limited to, the California Fair Chance Act, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. For positions covered by federal and/or state banking regulations, American Express will comply with such regulations as it relates to the consideration of applicants with criminal convictions.We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.US Job Seekers - Click to view the “Know Your Rights” poster. If the link does not work, you may access the poster by copying and pasting the following URL in a new browser window: https://www.eeoc.gov/posterEmployment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.

title: Analyst, AI Investment
descriptionHtml:
Company Description

At Llama Venture, we are a Silicon Valley-based early-stage firm dedicated to supporting founders who integrate advanced AI with deep domain expertise to revolutionize various industries. Our partners are repeat technical founders, which provides us with a thorough understanding and respect for technology. We invest in AI-native solutions across diverse sectors, including industrial automation, healthcare, fintech, climate, and next-gen tooling. We offer disciplined investing, independent conviction, and a respectful partnership that supports founders when needed and remains unobtrusive otherwise.


Position Overview: Analyst – AI Investments

Reports To: Principal / Partner


Key Responsibilities:

  • Deal Sourcing & Ecosystem Engagement: Actively discover promising AI startups by attending demo days, pitch competitions, academic conferences, founder meetups, and other tech-focused in-person events.
  • Relationship Building: Cultivate and maintain strong ties within the AI startup ecosystem, including founders, technologists, academics, incubators, angels, and early-stage operators.
  • Early Engagement: Identify and engage with high-potential, early-stage founders before they raise institutional rounds—helping to generate top-of-funnel deal flow.
  • Preliminary Diligence: Perform initial evaluations of startups—analyzing product/market fit, competitive landscape, founder profiles, and early traction.
  • Trend Tracking & Research: Monitor and analyze emerging trends within AI and ML (e.g., infrastructure developments, applied vertical solutions), providing strategic insights for the firm.
  • Internal Coordination: Maintain up-to-date internal deal databases, assist in crafting investment memos and market briefs, and support ongoing team strategy.


Qualifications:

  • 1–2 years of relevant experience—ideally in VC, startups, tech community building, or adjacent areas.
  • Deep passion for AI and startup innovation; well-connected and attuned to the AI founder community.
  • Confident and comfortable representing the firm in in-person networking settings.
  • Highly proactive, curious, self-motivated, and adept at spotting patterns and forming relationships.
  • Excellent analytical rigor and communication skills—able to distill complex information and convey insights effectively.
  • Bachelor's degree in a technical, business, or interdisciplinary field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or similar).


Full Time Position Salary: $80,000- $140,000


Open for Intern positions as well, with hourly rate from $28-$35/hour.

title: QA Analyst
descriptionHtml:
AMS is the premiere provider of payment integrity, risk management, and business intelligence solutions that drive smarter, faster, more cost-effective care.

Payment Integrity

Explore cutting-edge solutions that empower your team to automate payment integrity processes, avoid or recover overpayments, and reduce outsourcing costs.

Risk Management

Enhance critical coverage decisions with analytical tools that support >90% of all stop-loss and reinsurance premiums written annually.

Business Intelligence

Strengthen your contracts and policies with powerful predictive analytics, advanced reporting tools, and consultative support.

Job Title

Job Description – QA Analyst

QA Analyst

FLSA Status

Exempt

Department

Clinical

Reports To

VP, Complex Clinical Solutions

Primary Customers

Clinical Team, IT Team, Subscribers

Job Location:

Remote

Risk Designation

3

Position Overview/Summary Of Responsibilities

This position is responsible for implementing quality assurance (QA) procedures for product output and data received from clients to enhance Predict Suite solutions. The QA Analyst must possess good organizational skills with the ability to complete tasks with close attention to detail, understand and conceptualize technical clinical information, demonstrate efficient problem-solving skills, and communicate professionally.

Duties And Responsibilities

  • Perform QA procedures on findings within Predict Suite solutions
  • Perform end user testing and bug reporting for applications prior to customer availability
  • Provide feedback to clinical and IT teams on findings and recommendations
  • Document and manage report findings from QA procedures
  • Monitor and report opportunities for solution performance improvements and enhancements
  • Provide recommendations for future modifications to QA procedures
  • Adjust priorities as required to accomplish departmental objectives
  • Promote a safe and healthy work environment by adhering to organization standards and legal regulations
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Skills And Qualifications

  • Excellent computer proficiency, particularly with Microsoft products.
  • Experience with QA testing of web applications
  • Familiarity with project tracking software such as JIRA and Zoho
  • Familiarity with information security regulations and frameworks such as HITRUST and HIPAA
  • Ability to work independently with extreme attention to detail
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong team and collaborative skills
  • Familiarity with healthcare terminology related to drugs, implants, services/supplies, and medical coding standards (ICD, NDC, HCPCS) preferred

Education, Experience, And Licensing Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree preferred, in Science/Healthcare or Data Analytics/Information Management Systems, or related field
  • Experience in a healthcare or medical-related industry preferred

Suggested Pay Range

  • $65,000 - $75,000 commensurate with experience and education

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed and are not intended as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of the position. Nothing in this document is intended to exclude the opportunity for modifications or adjustment to the job or the manner of performing it consistent with the requirement to provide reasonable accommodations to the disabled. With or without accommodation, the essential functions must be performed. Employees unable to accomplish any functions may request reasonable accommodations pursuant to the Americans with Disability Act.

title: Controls/Automation Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Job Summary

Join our dynamic team as a Controls/Automation Engineer, where your expertise will be pivotal in executing comprehensive controls projects. This role encompasses concept development, research assistance, estimation, component selection, network and panel design, device troubleshooting, programming of PLCs and HMIs, on-site installations, debugging, and post-installation support. We seek a proactive individual with a solid foundation in controls engineering concepts and a strong commitment to continuous learning and advancement.

Essential Functions

  • Comprehend and apply knowledge of AC/DC control systems; interpret component specifications.
  • Utilize design engineering software and PLC programming tools effectively.
  • Diagnose system issues and communicate findings clearly both verbally and in writing.
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of successful control systems.
  • Assist in creating electrical circuit layouts for power and control distribution.
  • Participate in the generation of detailed schematic diagrams.
  • Support project installations and startups through comprehensive checklists.
  • Develop and correct electrical diagrams with precision and speed.
  • Be a key team player, fostering communication and collaboration.
  • Perform additional tasks as required to meet project objectives.

Required Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

  • Proficiency in various programming languages and control device networks for PLCs.
  • Commitment to ongoing training and certification in relevant control technologies.
  • Familiarity with controls, material handling, water and wastewater systems, and manufacturing processes.
  • Strong organizational skills, detail-oriented, and multi-tasking capabilities.
  • Ability to work independently and within team settings.
  • Critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Willingness to travel extensively and work flexible hours to meet project demands.

Education, Experience, And Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Electrical, Electrical Engineering Technology, or Computer Engineering and Computer Science preferred) or equivalent work experience.
  • 1-3 years of relevant experience in controls or automation engineering.
  • Experience in PLC programming, debugging, commissioning, hardware design, and using AutoCAD.
  • Basic understanding of electrical equipment and compliance with building codes like UL508a, NEC, and NFPA.
  • Preferred experience in mechanical and electrical troubleshooting, material handling, and familiarity with VFDs, servos, sensors, and vision systems.
  • Legal authorization to work in the United States and ability to obtain facility security clearance if required.

Work Environment

  • Combination of office and field settings with a collaborative and achievement-focused culture.
  • Travel required for up to 50% of the time.

Physical Demands

  • Prolonged sitting in office settings; standing and walking at job sites.
  • Climbing and lifting up to 50 pounds may be necessary at job sites.
  • Frequent typing and data entry tasks.

Work Schedule

  • Standard office hours are Monday to Friday, 7 am to 4 pm or 8 am to 5 pm, with flexibility required for job site work as per project needs.

title: Automation Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Join Goodwin’s Global Operations Team, and make a real impact on a global scale. At Goodwin, we work with some of the world’s most successful and innovative investors, entrepreneurs and disruptors in the life sciences, private equity, real estate, technology and financial industries, and where they converge. As part of the Global Operations Team – all business professionals at the firm – you’ll collaborate with colleagues from varied backgrounds and experiences, fostering an environment where cross-functional learning, networking, and collaboration are at the core of what we do.

Here, we’re not just supporting a law firm; we’re partnering with attorneys and clients to deliver cutting-edge solutions in high-stakes litigation and dispute resolution, world-class regulatory compliance and advisory services, and complex transactions. Our commitment to integrity, ingenuity, agility, and ambition drives us, and we’re proud to have been recognised as the “Best Business Team” by The American Lawyer.

This is your opportunity to grow professionally in a dynamic, global environment, surrounded by forward-thinking peers.

We are seeking a highly motivated Automation Engineer to join our Enterprise Applications team. This role will focus on designing, developing,deploying and supporting automation/orchestration workflows using low-code/no-code platforms to streamline business processes and improve operational efficiency. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in automation technologies and a passion for simplifying complex workflows through innovative solutions.

What You Will Do

  • Build automation workflows using Microsoft Power Platform (Power Automate, Power Apps, Power BI), Logic Apps, Forms, and other low-code/no-code tools to streamline business processes and improve operational efficiency.
  • Partner with business stakeholders and cross-functional teams (inc. but not limited to HR, Marketing, Finance, Client Development and legal practices) to gather requirements, define workflow logic, and ensure alignment with business objectives.
  • Develop scalable, secure, and maintainable automation solutions that integrate with enterprise systems such as SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, third-party SaaS platforms and other data sources. Create and maintain new connectors to various enterprise platforms
  • Partner with Transformation Team to continuously monitor and refine automation workflows to improve performance, reduce manual effort, and eliminate process bottlenecks.
  • Leverage Microsoft Azure AI services and related Generative AI tools to enhance automation workflows with intelligent decision-making and natural language processing capabilities.
  • Conduct thorough testing and validation of automation workflows to ensure reliability, accuracy, and compliance with organizational standards.
  • Keep current with emerging trends in low-code/no-code platforms, Microsoft ecosystem updates, and automation best practices.
  • Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of automation designs, configurations, and support procedures to ensure knowledge transfer and operational continuity.
  • Provide end-user support and training for deployed automation solutions, addressing issues and gathering feedback for continuous improvement.
  • Ensure all automation solutions adhere to IT governance, security, and compliance requirements.

Who You Are

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Relevant certifications are a plus.
  • Demonstrated experience as an Automation Engineer with expertise in Microsoft Azure-based tools.
  • Strong understanding of Microsoft Power Platform (especially PowerApps and Power Automate), Azure Logic Apps, and Azure Functions. Familiarity with cloud-based automation architecture, REST APIs, and integration patterns across Microsoft 365 and Azure ecosystems.
  • Proficient in scripting and an understanding of programming languages such as Powershell, JavaScript, Power Fx, C#, and Python. Experience with building custom connectors, managing data sources (e.g., Dataverse, SQL, SharePoint), and deploying solutions in enterprise environments.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business needs into scalable automation solutions leveraging process improvement frameworks such as Lean, Six Sigma and Agile. Strong communication and collaboration abilities, with a proactive approach to learning and applying new technologies. Comfortable working in agile, cross-functional teams and managing multiple priorities.

Benefits And More

At Goodwin, you will discover your next career opportunity with a rewarding compensation package and comprehensive benefits, including:

  • Flexible work arrangements and hybrid work schedule
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Life and disability insurance
  • Retirement & Savings Plan
  • Emergency back-up child and adult care
  • Paid vacation, sick time off, and holidays
  • Professional development and career advancement opportunities
  • Employee recognition and reward programs
  • Employee wellness and assistance programs
  • Employee discounts and perks

Consistent with the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance an arrest and conviction record will not automatically disqualify a qualified applicant from consideration.

Consistent with the SF Fair Chance Ordinance, an arrest and conviction record will not automatically disqualify a qualified applicant from consideration.

Goodwin Procter LLP is an equal opportunity employer. This means that Goodwin Procter LLP considers applicants for employment, and makes employment decisions without unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or other legally protected status.

To request a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process in the US, contact the Benefits Department by email or by phone at 617-570-1800. To request any disability or neurodivergence related accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process in the UK or Germany, please email the Recruiting Department. Any information you provide will be in the strictest confidence, and only used for the purpose of providing the accommodations needed. Requesting accommodations will not adversely affect the outcome of your application.

This position is eligible for overtime: Yes

The target salary range for this position varies by location and is commensurate with relevant experience: Boston $87,600 - $131,400 | Los Angeles $92,000 - $138,000 | New York $92,000 - $138,000 | Philadelphia $82,400 - $123,600 | San Francisco $98,100 - $147,200 | Santa Monica $92,000 - $138,000 | Silicon Valley $98,100 - $147,200 | Washington DC $87,600 - $131,400

title: Automation Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Work Location: United States – Remote (Central or Pacific time zones)

Work Schedule: Monday – Friday; regular business hours

Engagement Model: Temporary employment; Full-time (40 hours/week)

Estimated Start Date: As soon as possible

Estimated Duration: 4 months, with chance for extension



DataForce by TransPerfect is seeking a full-time Automation Engineer to join our team on a temporary basis. This is a remote opportunity, open to candidates based in the United States within the Central or Pacific time zones.


Role Summary

Responsible for developing and maintaining automation tools, managing database operations, performing media quality checks, preparing lab environments for research studies, and ensuring efficient file handling to support team workflows.


Role Responsibilities

  • Build and maintain Python scripts for automation and process optimization
  • Manage and update MySQL databases with accuracy and efficiency
  • Set up, configure, and troubleshoot devices for lab studies
  • Perform QA checks on video and audio files
  • Organize and track media files to ensure proper naming and storage
  • Troubleshoot technical and process issues quickly


Role Requirements

  • Proficiency in Python for scripting and automation
  • Strong experience with MySQL and PostgreSQL databases (including Amazon RDS)
  • Familiarity with FFmpeg for media processing and conversion
  • Comfortable using the macOS terminal and writing shell scripts
  • Hands-on experience with AWS S3 for storage and data management
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Excel for reporting and analysis
  • Working knowledge of iOS (iPhone) and Android platforms for testing and troubleshooting
  • Experience with device setup, configuration, and testing across multiple platforms
  • Ability to perform media quality assurance (QA) and manage large file sets
  • Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on process automation
  • Excellent documentation skills and ability to communicate effectively across teams



DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.


DataForce by TransPerfect offers high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our department focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.


To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce


TransPerfect provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

title: Junior Software Test Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Job Description


The Junior-Level Test Engineer position is ideal for a new or recent college graduate with software systems engineering concentration. It is an entry-level position for a person with interest in systems engineering, software engineering, and/or business process engineering. This role is suitable for individuals with a foundational understanding of software testing principles and Agile methodologies, who are eager to gain hands-on experience and further develop their skills in a dynamic team environment. The testing professional is responsible for assisting in the testing process to ensure the quality and reliability of software products. With prior exposure to Agile environments, they contribute to test execution, defect tracking, and collaboration within Agile teams.

To be really successful in the long term, the person should be comfortable coding at an entry level in Python and the desire to expand software development skills. While there is a functional testing emphasis early on, the growth will be in the automation of testing in the performance, anomaly, and regression test domains.



The Work Include



Test Execution: Execute test cases, scenarios, and scripts as per test plans, recording test results, and verifying software functionality against acceptance criteria.


Defect Reporting and Tracking: Identify, document, and prioritize defects found during testing, ensuring accurate and timely reporting to development teams.


Agile Collaboration: Participate in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and sprint reviews, collaborating with Agile teams to prioritize testing activities and provide regular updates on testing progress.


Regression Testing Support: Assist in conducting regression testing to validate software changes and ensure that existing functionality remains intact after modifications or enhancements.


Documentation: Maintain test documentation including test cases, test scripts, and test results, ensuring completeness and accuracy for future reference.


Continuous Learning: Engage in self-study, training, and professional development activities to enhance skills and knowledge in software testing principles, test automation, and Agile methodologies.


Test Automation Support: Assist in test automation efforts by contributing to the development and maintenance of automated test scripts, frameworks, and tools under the guidance of senior test engineers.


Exploratory Testing: Conduct exploratory testing sessions to uncover defects and validate software behavior from end-users' perspectives, contributing to overall testing effectiveness.



Required Education, Experience, & Skills


A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, engineering, or related field is preferred.



Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills


Relevant certifications such as ISTQB Foundation Level, Agile Tester Foundation, or similar certifications demonstrating proficiency in software testing and Agile methodologies are beneficial but not required.

Exposure to python development in college projects is a plus


Pay Information

Full-Time Salary Range: $77809 - $132275

Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.

Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.



About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security


BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

Intelligence & Security (I&S), based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.

This position will be posted for at least 5 calendar days. The posting will remain active until the position is filled, or a qualified pool of candidates is identified.

title: Data Integrity Analyst
descriptionHtml:
The Stepping Stones Group is transforming the lives of children, families, and communities together through our exceptional therapeutic and behavioral health services. We believe our Core Values embody the culture of our organization: Trust, Integrity, Results, Quality, Community, and Inclusivity.


The Stepping Stones Group is committed to diversity and inclusion. As a socially conscious employer driven by purpose, we welcome all people who have the heart to join us in our mission to transform lives together. We celebrate the diversity of our colleagues and believe by listening, learning, and empathizing with each other's life experiences we become a stronger organization.


Data Integrity Analyst, Operations

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Integrity Analyst to join our Operations team,

supporting the success of our production team and back-office team.

In this role, you will be responsible for monitoring, validating, and improving the quality of operational, client, and workforce data to support decision-making and compliance. You will collaborate with operations, recruitment, and finance to identify discrepancies, resolve data issues, and implement best practices in data governance.


Key Responsibilities


Data Management & Reporting

• Collect, clean, and maintain large datasets from multiple sources including CRM, ATS, HRIS, and

financial systems.

• Develop and maintain dashboards, scorecards, and automated reporting tools for operational KPIs through Power BI.

• Monitor daily, weekly, and monthly performance against targets for staffing levels, fill rates, and client satisfaction.


Operational Analysis

• Analyze trends in school staffing demand, workforce availability, and seasonal fluctuations.

• Identify bottlenecks in candidate placement and recommend solutions to improve speed-to-fill.

• Conduct variance analysis on projected vs. actual staffing fulfillment.

• Track operational costs and resource utilization to support budgetary decisions.


Strategic Insights

• Provide data-driven recommendations to optimize territory assignments, recruiter performance, and service coverage.

• Support workforce planning by forecasting staffing needs based on historical and predictive analytics.

• Collaborate with leadership to identify process improvements and automation opportunities.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

• Partner with recruitment, HR, and finance teams to align operational data with company-wide objectives.

• Work with IT and data engineering teams to ensure accurate and consistent data pipelines.

• Assist client service managers with custom data requests and client-facing reporting.


Qualifications

Education & Experience

• Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Business, Statistics, or related field (or equivalent experience).

• 2+ years of experience in data analytics, preferably within staffing, education services, or operations.

• Proficiency in Excel, SQL, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).


Skills & Competencies

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail.

• Ability to interpret complex datasets and present findings in a clear, business-friendly manner.

• Familiarity with KPIs relevant to staffing and school operations (fill rate, time-to-fill, retention, etc.).

• Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities.

• Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

• Accuracy and timeliness of operational reports.

• Improvement in fill rate and time-to-fill metrics.

• Reduction in operational inefficiencies.

• Quality and clarity of insights delivered to stakeholders

title: Manual QA Tester (Web/Mobile)
descriptionHtml:
Why Badger Meter?

Badger Meter is a leading global water technology company, with a mission to preserve and protect the world’s most precious resource. For more than 100 years, cities and businesses have utilized our innovative and trusted solutions to enhance operational efficiency and conserve water while making it more affordable, clean and resilient. Just like every drop counts, at Badger Meter every employee counts because our contributions have a lasting impact on the world!

Here at Badger Meter, we believe that our approach to diversity, equity, and inclusion is the very foundation of our success. Our commitment is reflected in our core values, where we strive to create an environment that celebrates differences, encourages innovation, and ensures that every voice is celebrated and appreciated.

We understand that a diverse team brings a variety of perspectives and ideas, which ultimately fosters creativity and excellence. Badger Meter provides opportunities for career growth and development for every employee by creating a supportive and inclusive workplace where they can make meaningful contributions while preserving the world’s most precious resource.

What You Will Contribute:

Are you eager to launch your tech career with a company that’s improving the planet—one drop at a time? Join Badger Meter as a Manual Software QA Tester and play a meaningful role in enhancing the quality of web and mobile applications that support smart water management across the globe.

At Badger Meter, innovation meets impact. With over a century of expertise and a deep commitment to environmental sustainability, we’re not just making great software—we’re helping communities monitor, conserve, and protect one of Earth’s most precious resources: water.

This entry-level role is focused on ensuring the quality of our web and mobile software applications through manual testing. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, analytical, and communicative—someone who is eager to learn, asks thoughtful questions, and collaborates well with others. This person does not have to come in with extensive software or technical experience, we are willing to train!

You will design and execute test cases, verify functionality, identify issues, and provide valuable feedback to developers and product teams. While the focus of this role is manual testing, some basic technical skills (e.g., Python scripting, SQL queries, API tools) will be used to support test efforts. This is not an automation engineering role, but technical curiosity and hands-on troubleshooting are encouraged and supported. This is a hybrid role with a minimum three days a week in the office in Los Gatos.

Essential Job Duties:

  • Execute manual tests based on user stories, requirements, and design documentation
  • Identify, document, and verify bugs and inconsistencies using tools like Jira
  • Perform functional, regression, exploratory, and integration testing across web and mobile platforms
  • Use API testing tools (e.g., Postman, Swagger) and scripts to verify data and application behavior
  • Assist in creating and maintaining test cases, checklists, and validation documents
  • Collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and other QA team members
  • Validate defect fixes and confirm resolution without introducing new issues
  • Participate in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, standups, and reviews
  • Learn and follow QA best practices and team workflows
  • Support product quality efforts with clear, concise communication and follow-through
  • Wage between 72,000-96,000 annually depending on experience.


Qualifications:

  • Associate or Bachelor’s degree in an analytical or technical field (e.g., Math, Statistics, Information Systems, or similar) is preferred, but not required
  • Strong attention to detail, analytical thinking, and problem-solving ability
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; not afraid to ask questions or challenge assumptions
  • Ability to learn quickly and work effectively in a cross-functional team


Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with web and/or mobile application testing is a plus
  • Familiarity with Python scripting and basic SQL is desirable
  • Understanding of software development lifecycles and Agile methodologies is helpful
  • Comfortable using tools like Jira, Confluence, and basic API testing platforms


Competitive Total Rewards at Badger Meter:

  • Competitive Pay
  • Annual Bonus
  • Eligible for Annual Pay Increases
  • Comprehensive Health, Vision, and Dental Coverage
  • 15 days Paid Time Off + 11 Paid Holidays
  • Two Ways to Save for Retirement: Badger Meter contributes 25 cents for every dollar you contribute to the plan, up to 7% of your eligible compensation. In addition to the match, the company will also contribute 5% of your eligible compensation to your Defined Contribution account on an annual basis. Additional access to a certified financial planner to help ensure your money is working for you, at no cost!
  • Employer Paid benefits including: Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Basic Group Life Insurance, Short Term Disability, and more
  • Educational Assistance – Tuition Reimbursement up to $5,250
  • Voluntary benefits including: Additional Life Insurance, Long Term Disability, Accident and Critical Illness coverage
  • Health Savings Account (HSA) & Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options


An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights regarding equal opportunity in employment by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and the “EEO is the Law” poster supplement at http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm

Badger Meter complies with all aspects of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), as amended by the ADA Amendments Act, and all applicable state or local disability laws. This means that we will reasonably accommodate qualified employees with a disability if accommodation would allow them to perform the essential functions of their job, unless doing so would create an undue hardship.

Privacy Statement

The Employee and Applicant Privacy Statement describes how we collect, use, share, retain, and safeguard applicant information. Please see the privacy statement on our website here.

title: Digital Marketing Campaign Coordinator - Full Time - Remote
descriptionHtml:
Do you have a passion for deploying the latest in advertising technology? Apply to be a part of our innovative political digital media team. Create and implement the most forward-thinking digital strategies in the political sector.


At Neptune Ops, we focus on one thing so that we can do it our best—we deploy the latest technology from Silicon Valley to help clients succeed in public affairs and electoral campaigns. We help our clients avoid the pitfalls of technology disruptions, and capitalize on the opportunities created by these changes. 


As our company continues to grow, you’ll be an important part of supporting our campaigns. You’ll help empower our clients to leverage the latest AI and other technology to drive political outcomes. 


Job Overview:


The Digital Ops Coordinator manages and optimizes digital marketing campaigns in a fast-paced environment. This position plays a critical role in executing, monitoring, and analyzing multi-channel campaigns that advance our clients’ political advocacy goals. The ideal candidate has 2+ years of related experience, is detail-oriented, data-driven, and passionate about leveraging digital platforms to create measurable impact. 


Position Responsibilities:


  • Plan, launch, and manage programmatic digital marketing campaigns across various channels including display, online video, connected TV, digital audio, digital out-of-home, and native formats.
  • Manage campaign operations within digital platforms, ensuring proper setup, tracking, QA, and reporting.
  • Segment audiences and deliver targeted messaging to advance advocacy objectives.
  • Collaborate with creative and content teams to ensure assets align with campaign strategy and are deployed accurately.
  • Monitor key campaign metrics, prepare performance reports and dashboards, and provide actionable insights to stakeholders.
  • Stay current with AI-driven digital marketing developments, ad platform updates, and other new technologies.
  • Perform audience research using the last AI frontier models and other tools.
  • Manage grassroots digital advocacy campaigns.


Ideal Qualifications:


  • Demonstrated interest in learning and deploying the latest AI tools across a variety of marketing and advertising applications.
  • Bachelor’s degree and 2+ years of experience in digital marketing with direct campaign management responsibilities.
  • Proven track record running programmatic advertising campaigns (search and social welcome as related training, however, this is primarily a programmatic advertising role).
  • Experience with marketing automation and CRM tools such as HubSpot.
  • Experience with Canva, design, or other related tools.
  • Comfort with project management tools such as Asana.
  • Experience with spreadsheets for budgeting and data analytics.
  • Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple campaigns simultaneously in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Understanding of and interest in federal and state political environments strongly preferred.
  • Ability to work in U.S. Central or Mountain time preferred.


This is a fully remote, full time benefits eligible position. Neptune Ops provides a robust suite of benefits including: discretionary time off, health, dental, vision, mental health, pet, and legal insurance as well as 401(k) match, sick time, holiday pay, and paid time off for bereavement and jury duty. The anticipated base salary range for this position is $60,000-$85,000. Base compensation is determined by many factors including: geography, the candidate’s skills, experience, and internal equity. In addition to base salary, employees are eligible for our annual bonus program. 


To apply, please submit an application via LinkedIn and also email resume and a short cover letter outlining your background and experience to Nora Miller (nora@neptuneops.com).


﻿Neptune Ops is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws.


Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law.
descriptionText: Do you have a passion for deploying the latest in advertising technology? Apply to be a part of our innovative political digital media team. Create and implement the most forward-thinking digital strategies in the political sector.At Neptune Ops, we focus on one thing so that we can do it our best—we deploy the latest technology from Silicon Valley to help clients succeed in public affairs and electoral campaigns. We help our clients avoid the pitfalls of technology disruptions, and capitalize on the opportunities created by these changes. As our company continues to grow, you’ll be an important part of supporting our campaigns. You’ll help empower our clients to leverage the latest AI and other technology to drive political outcomes. Job Overview:The Digital Ops Coordinator manages and optimizes digital marketing campaigns in a fast-paced environment. This position plays a critical role in executing, monitoring, and analyzing multi-channel campaigns that advance our clients’ political advocacy goals. The ideal candidate has 2+ years of related experience, is detail-oriented, data-driven, and passionate about leveraging digital platforms to create measurable impact. Position Responsibilities:Plan, launch, and manage programmatic digital marketing campaigns across various channels including display, online video, connected TV, digital audio, digital out-of-home, and native formats.Manage campaign operations within digital platforms, ensuring proper setup, tracking, QA, and reporting.Segment audiences and deliver targeted messaging to advance advocacy objectives.Collaborate with creative and content teams to ensure assets align with campaign strategy and are deployed accurately.Monitor key campaign metrics, prepare performance reports and dashboards, and provide actionable insights to stakeholders.Stay current with AI-driven digital marketing developments, ad platform updates, and other new technologies.Perform audience research using the last AI frontier models and other tools.Manage grassroots digital advocacy campaigns.Ideal Qualifications:Demonstrated interest in learning and deploying the latest AI tools across a variety of marketing and advertising applications.Bachelor’s degree and 2+ years of experience in digital marketing with direct campaign management responsibilities.Proven track record running programmatic advertising campaigns (search and social welcome as related training, however, this is primarily a programmatic advertising role).Experience with marketing automation and CRM tools such as HubSpot.Experience with Canva, design, or other related tools.Comfort with project management tools such as Asana.Experience with spreadsheets for budgeting and data analytics.Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple campaigns simultaneously in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Understanding of and interest in federal and state political environments strongly preferred.Ability to work in U.S. Central or Mountain time preferred.This is a fully remote, full time benefits eligible position. Neptune Ops provides a robust suite of benefits including: discretionary time off, health, dental, vision, mental health, pet, and legal insurance as well as 401(k) match, sick time, holiday pay, and paid time off for bereavement and jury duty. The anticipated base salary range for this position is $60,000-$85,000. Base compensation is determined by many factors including: geography, the candidate’s skills, experience, and internal equity. In addition to base salary, employees are eligible for our annual bonus program. To apply, please submit an application via LinkedIn and also email resume and a short cover letter outlining your background and experience to Nora Miller (nora@neptuneops.com).﻿Neptune Ops is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law.

title: Python Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Must Have skills: Developing Automation Scripts using Python, Middleware Platforms, AI Integrations



 



Job Description:



This role will focus on building automation solutions to enhance middleware infrastructure and operational efficiency, with a strong emphasis on leveraging AI-driven technologies (including tools like ChatGPT) to improve processes and performance.



You will work closely with engineering and operations teams to design, implement, and maintain automation frameworks that support critical middleware platforms across the enterprise.






Key Responsibilities




  • Design, develop, and maintain automation scripts and frameworks using Python and shell scripting to streamline middleware operations and deployments.

  • Collaborate with middleware engineers to identify automation opportunities in provisioning, configuration, monitoring, and incident resolution.

  • Integrate AI tools (including Chat GPT and other LLM-based solutions) into automation workflows for predictive analytics, intelligent troubleshooting, and enhanced operational insights.

  • Partner with infrastructure and application teams to ensure automation aligns with enterprise security, compliance, and performance standards.

  • Contribute to AI-driven proof of concepts and pilots for automation in the middleware space.

  • Provide support for automation tools and scripts in production, ensuring stability and reliability.

  • Maintain documentation for developed scripts, workflows, and integrations.






Required Skills & Experience




  • Strong proficiency in Python and shell scripting (Bash, KornShell, etc.).

  • Proven experience developing automation solutions for middleware platforms (e.g., WebSphere, WebLogic, Tomcat, MQ, Kafka, etc.).

  • Solid understanding of AI concepts and experience integrating AI/ML models or APIs (OpenAI, ChatGPT, Azure Cognitive Services, etc.) into automation processes.

  • Familiarity with enterprise infrastructure environments, including Linux/Unix administration.

  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex middleware and automation issues.

  • Experience with version control (Git), CI/CD pipelines, and DevOps practices.



Ability to work in a fast-paced, large-scale financial services environment

title: Data Analyst
descriptionHtml:
About Ascendion :

Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.

Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life

We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:

  • Build the coolest tech for world’s leading brands
  • Solve complex problems - and learn new skills
  • Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients
  • Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience

Experience a community of change makers!

Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.

About the Role:

Position: Data Analyst

Location: Remote (USA) (PST)

Summary:


The main function of a Data Analyst is to coordinate changes to computer databases, test, and implement the database applying knowledge of database management systems.


Job Responsibilities:


  • Work with senior management, technical and client teams in order to determine data requirements, business data implementation approaches, best practices for advanced data manipulation, storage and analysis strategies
  • Write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system or direct others in coding descriptions
  • Design, implement, automate and maintain large scale enterprise data ETL processes
  • Modify existing databases and database management systems and/or direct programmers and analysts to make changes
  • Test programs or databases, correct errors and make necessary modifications


Skills:

  • Experience with database technologies
  • Knowledge of the ETL process
  • Knowledge of at least one scripting language
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills
  • Demonstrated history of success
  • Desire to be working with data and helping businesses make better data driven decisions


Education/Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required
  • 0-2 years applicable experience required

Salary Range: $62,000 - 68,000 Annually - Factors that may affect pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate.

Benefits: The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: [medical insurance] [dental insurance] [vision insurance] [401(k) retirement plan] [long-term disability insurance] [short-term disability insurance] [5 personal day accrued each calendar year. The Paid time off benefits meet the paid sick and safe time laws that pertains to the City/ State] [10-15 day of paid vacation time] [6 paid holidays and 1 floating holiday per calendar year] [Ascendion Learning Management System]

Want to change the world? Let us know.

Tell us about your experiences, education, and ambitions. Bring your knowledge, unique viewpoint, and creativity to the table. Let’s talk!

title: Automation Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Join Goodwin’s Global Operations Team, and make a real impact on a global scale. At Goodwin, we work with some of the world’s most successful and innovative investors, entrepreneurs and disruptors in the life sciences, private equity, real estate, technology and financial industries, and where they converge. As part of the Global Operations Team – all business professionals at the firm – you’ll collaborate with colleagues from varied backgrounds and experiences, fostering an environment where cross-functional learning, networking, and collaboration are at the core of what we do.

Here, we’re not just supporting a law firm; we’re partnering with attorneys and clients to deliver cutting-edge solutions in high-stakes litigation and dispute resolution, world-class regulatory compliance and advisory services, and complex transactions. Our commitment to integrity, ingenuity, agility, and ambition drives us, and we’re proud to have been recognised as the “Best Business Team” by The American Lawyer.

This is your opportunity to grow professionally in a dynamic, global environment, surrounded by forward-thinking peers.

We are seeking a highly motivated Automation Engineer to join our Enterprise Applications team. This role will focus on designing, developing,deploying and supporting automation/orchestration workflows using low-code/no-code platforms to streamline business processes and improve operational efficiency. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in automation technologies and a passion for simplifying complex workflows through innovative solutions.

What You Will Do

  • Build automation workflows using Microsoft Power Platform (Power Automate, Power Apps, Power BI), Logic Apps, Forms, and other low-code/no-code tools to streamline business processes and improve operational efficiency.
  • Partner with business stakeholders and cross-functional teams (inc. but not limited to HR, Marketing, Finance, Client Development and legal practices) to gather requirements, define workflow logic, and ensure alignment with business objectives.
  • Develop scalable, secure, and maintainable automation solutions that integrate with enterprise systems such as SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, third-party SaaS platforms and other data sources. Create and maintain new connectors to various enterprise platforms
  • Partner with Transformation Team to continuously monitor and refine automation workflows to improve performance, reduce manual effort, and eliminate process bottlenecks.
  • Leverage Microsoft Azure AI services and related Generative AI tools to enhance automation workflows with intelligent decision-making and natural language processing capabilities.
  • Conduct thorough testing and validation of automation workflows to ensure reliability, accuracy, and compliance with organizational standards.
  • Keep current with emerging trends in low-code/no-code platforms, Microsoft ecosystem updates, and automation best practices.
  • Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of automation designs, configurations, and support procedures to ensure knowledge transfer and operational continuity.
  • Provide end-user support and training for deployed automation solutions, addressing issues and gathering feedback for continuous improvement.
  • Ensure all automation solutions adhere to IT governance, security, and compliance requirements.

Who You Are

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Relevant certifications are a plus.
  • Demonstrated experience as an Automation Engineer with expertise in Microsoft Azure-based tools.
  • Strong understanding of Microsoft Power Platform (especially PowerApps and Power Automate), Azure Logic Apps, and Azure Functions. Familiarity with cloud-based automation architecture, REST APIs, and integration patterns across Microsoft 365 and Azure ecosystems.
  • Proficient in scripting and an understanding of programming languages such as Powershell, JavaScript, Power Fx, C#, and Python. Experience with building custom connectors, managing data sources (e.g., Dataverse, SQL, SharePoint), and deploying solutions in enterprise environments.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business needs into scalable automation solutions leveraging process improvement frameworks such as Lean, Six Sigma and Agile. Strong communication and collaboration abilities, with a proactive approach to learning and applying new technologies. Comfortable working in agile, cross-functional teams and managing multiple priorities.

Benefits And More

At Goodwin, you will discover your next career opportunity with a rewarding compensation package and comprehensive benefits, including:

  • Flexible work arrangements and hybrid work schedule
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Life and disability insurance
  • Retirement & Savings Plan
  • Emergency back-up child and adult care
  • Paid vacation, sick time off, and holidays
  • Professional development and career advancement opportunities
  • Employee recognition and reward programs
  • Employee wellness and assistance programs
  • Employee discounts and perks

Consistent with the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance an arrest and conviction record will not automatically disqualify a qualified applicant from consideration.

Consistent with the SF Fair Chance Ordinance, an arrest and conviction record will not automatically disqualify a qualified applicant from consideration.

Goodwin Procter LLP is an equal opportunity employer. This means that Goodwin Procter LLP considers applicants for employment, and makes employment decisions without unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or other legally protected status.

To request a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process in the US, contact the Benefits Department by email or by phone at 617-570-1800. To request any disability or neurodivergence related accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process in the UK or Germany, please email the Recruiting Department. Any information you provide will be in the strictest confidence, and only used for the purpose of providing the accommodations needed. Requesting accommodations will not adversely affect the outcome of your application.

This position is eligible for overtime: Yes

The target salary range for this position varies by location and is commensurate with relevant experience: Boston $87,600 - $131,400 | Los Angeles $92,000 - $138,000 | New York $92,000 - $138,000 | Philadelphia $82,400 - $123,600 | San Francisco $98,100 - $147,200 | Santa Monica $92,000 - $138,000 | Silicon Valley $98,100 - $147,200 | Washington DC $87,600 - $131,400

title: Controls Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Come join Bastian Solutions where you have the satisfaction of designing and developing various systems that come to life. We are currently hiring for a Controls Engineer that is responsible for multiple controls projects.


Job Overview

Our engineers help design, test, program and commission very exciting projects in the world of Material Handling. If you have experience with PLC’s, HMI, SCADA or other Controls systems experience then come investigate further a company that has a family cultural but is part of the Toyota family known for safety and quality.


Job Functions

  • Conduct full scope of controls projects that will involve programming with PLC/HMI or other various technologies.
  • Work within a team environment of project deliverables.
  • Learn new technologies via in-house or external training.
  • Develop processes to help support our team growth.
  • Solve problems for our team and customers.
  • Deliver projects that meet or exceed customer's expectations.
  • Develop customers relationships.
  • Contribute to project teams, providing help outside of controls scope when required.
  • Establish beneficial relationships with our key supplier products and service and provide technical assistance around issues or solutions.
  • Develop new controls techniques or equipment that will help maintain Bastian as a leader in our industry.


Travel Requirements:

  • Ability to travel 30 to 50% at times might be required. (two-week rotation)


Required Qualification and Preferred Skills:

  • BS in Engineering or MS in Engineering (preferred).
  • 4+ years’ experience, PLC, HMI, SCADA, panel design experience, hands on and mechanical capabilities, controls project managing experience.
  • Experience with MS Office products.
  • AutoCAD Electrical experience preferred.
  • Material Handling Integration experience preferred.
  • Communication and Organization Skills
  • Must be eligible to work in the USA long term without sponsorship.


To learn more about us, click here - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_wJsktTkF50

title: Automation Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Work Location: United States – Remote (Central or Pacific time zones)

Work Schedule: Monday – Friday; regular business hours

Engagement Model: Temporary employment; Full-time (40 hours/week)

Estimated Start Date: As soon as possible

Estimated Duration: 4 months, with chance for extension


DataForce by TransPerfect is seeking a full-time Automation Engineer to join our team on a temporary basis. This is a remote opportunity, open to candidates based in the United States within the Central or Pacific time zones.


Role Summary

Responsible for developing and maintaining automation tools, managing database operations, performing media quality checks, preparing lab environments for research studies, and ensuring efficient file handling to support team workflows.


Role Responsibilities

  • Build and maintain Python scripts for automation and process optimization
  • Manage and update MySQL databases with accuracy and efficiency
  • Set up, configure, and troubleshoot devices for lab studies
  • Perform QA checks on video and audio files
  • Organize and track media files to ensure proper naming and storage
  • Troubleshoot technical and process issues quickly


Role Requirements

  • Proficiency in Python for scripting and automation
  • Strong experience with MySQL and PostgreSQL databases (including Amazon RDS)
  • Familiarity with FFmpeg for media processing and conversion
  • Comfortable using the macOS terminal and writing shell scripts
  • Hands-on experience with AWS S3 for storage and data management
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Excel for reporting and analysis
  • Working knowledge of iOS (iPhone) and Android platforms for testing and troubleshooting
  • Experience with device setup, configuration, and testing across multiple platforms
  • Ability to perform media quality assurance (QA) and manage large file sets
  • Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on process automation
  • Excellent documentation skills and ability to communicate effectively across teams


DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.


DataForce by TransPerfect offers high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our department focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.


To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce


TransPerfect provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce TransPerfect provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

title: Test Automation Engineer
descriptionHtml:
New York eHealth Collaborative – Test Automation Engineer

New York eHealth Collaborative (NYeC) is a not-for-profit organization working in partnership with the New York State Department of Health to improve healthcare by collaboratively leading, connecting, and integrating health information exchange across the State.


Founded in 2006 by healthcare leaders, NYeC works to help New York State achieve the Triple Aim of improving the patient experience of care, delivering better health outcomes, and reducing costs. On behalf of the State, NYeC leads the Statewide Health Information Network for New York (SHIN-NY), a network connecting healthcare providers statewide, develops policies and standards that support the utilization of health technologies, and assists healthcare providers in adopting and effectively using electronic health records


Position Summary

NYeC is seeking a Test Automation Engineer with experience working in a data-centric environment. The candidate should have a strong sense of how to prove and demonstrate that an environment works and stays working by using industry standard automated testing tools. The Test Automation Engineer should have experience owning the test environment assets, working with data engineers and other internal stakeholders, and contribute an informed perspective on the opportunities and limitations of AI in large-scale testing. This position will report to the Director of Product and can be operated out of the Albany, NY or Manhattan, NY office on a hybrid work schedule.


Primary Responsibilities:

Quality Assurance & Testing

  • Ensure new features meet functional requirements and do not negatively impact existing functionality.
  • Facilitate efficient troubleshooting with Data Engineers by reducing the time spent reproducing issues.
  • Identify, document, and track defects or inconsistencies in software behavior.


Test Automation

  • Design, develop, and maintain automated test suites using industry-standard frameworks (e.g., Selenium, PyTest, TestNG, Cypress).
  • Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to ensure continuous validation of software releases.
  • Create reusable scripts and processes that can be executed manually or automatically via CI/CD.
  • Provide ways for non-developer stakeholders to contribute to and view test results.
  • Monitor and optimize tests to minimize compute usage and execution time in cloud environment.


Test Documentation & Reporting

  • Author detailed test plans, cases, and scripts aligned with business and technical requirements.
  • Document manual QA efforts, providing permanent evidence of test results and outcomes.
  • Maintain a centralized repository of test artifacts for audit and compliance purposes.


Data & Environment Management

  • Orchestrate tests across multiple databases and systems (Snowflake, NoSQL, DynamoDB).
  • Obfuscate or synthesize data to maintain privacy and comply with regulatory requirements, including HIPAA.
  • Experience with Synthea or similar data generation tool is a plus.
  • Understand healthcare standards such as HL7, CDA, PIXV3, and FHIR to support testing in healthcare-related environments.


Other Responsibilities

  • Participate in continuous improvement of QA processes, tools, and standards.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, data engineers, and product managers, to enhance overall software quality.
  • Perform other ad hoc duties as as assigned.


Experience and Skills Required:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
  • 5+ years of professional experience in software quality assurance, test automation, or related roles.
  • Proficiency with test automation frameworks: Selenium, PyTest, TestNG, Cypress.
  • Experience with CI/CD tools and integrating automated tests into pipelines.
  • Familiarity with cloud technologies and orchestration tools such as Airflow (MWAA), PythonOperator, Datagaps, CloudFormation, Terraform.
  • Experience with databases including Snowflake, DynamoDB, or other NoSQL systems.
  • Understanding of cost implications of compute usage for automated tests in cloud environments.
  • Experience with healthcare-related standards and compliance (HL7, CDA, PIXV3, HIPAA) is a plus.
  • Ability to design and implement repeatable, reliable, and maintainable test processes.
  • Strong problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
  • Able to work independently and collaborate effectively in team settings.


Expectations of Employees:

  • Employees work a hybrid in-office schedule (at either our Manhattan, NY or Albany, NY office and then remotely). Barring specific exemptions, team members are expected to work from the office on a regular schedule determined by the CCOO and on other days specified by their manager (no less than 1 day per week in the office). This schedule is subject to change.
  • NYeC supports work happening across New York State. From time to time our team members must visit other parts of the state. The most common requirement is for a New York City based team member to travel to Albany and vice versa.


We consider a wide range of factors when determining compensation, which may cause compensation to vary depending on your skills, experience, qualifications, and home office location (Manhattan, NY vs. Albany, NY). The annual base salary range for this role for an Albany based candidate is $80,000 -95,000. The annual base salary range for this role for a NYC based candidate is $100,000 – $120,000. The salary offer will not be based on a candidate’s salary history at other jobs, and by law, NYeC will not seek information about salary history, and candidates should not share such information with NYeC. All compensation questions and comments should be directed to the HR Department representative during your application, interview, and hiring process.


For more information about NYeC and to apply for this position, visit our website at https://www.nyehealth.org/careers/. We accept online applications only.
